author: ogel646
title: Worthy to have
review:
This is a small set in this new Pirate theme,and it contains 45 pieces only but costs you $5.99.However,its cannon can shoot REALLY WELL that you will never regert to have such a set.

Pros:
2 figures(with front and back printing),
cool weapons,
and a MUST HAVE CANNON!
All patterns are printed and no sticker

Cons:
A little expensive(but worthy)

author: Captin_Rex
title: Great Deal!
review:
This set is a must have set. It may look small but theres alot to it then what you see. Its also my first pirate set. Now lets see some pros and cons.

pros,

1. 2 minifiures
2. weapons, 2 swords, 1 gun, a map
3. a canon
4. rock hide out thing
5. some good pieces

cons,
1. little over price for a 45 piece set.(cost $6)

This set is a must buy set. So you should pick one up when you get a chance.

author: Smallsam99
title: Worth the wait!
review:
This is part of the brand new lego pirates theme finally revived after years of waiting! These new sets feature new imperials and revision of classic pirates. The unique feature of these guys is that they have a two sided torso which is cool! Some new elements and pieces are finally thrown in too. Now to the review.
pros: The imperial guard and pirate in one set!

low price

The new canon!

good weapon assortment

torch

Cons: a little high for piece count.

Overall good starter set for the pirates theme if you have none and is pretty good! I rate it about 9/10 and advise you get this set!

author: DarthVader_
title: Great Little Army Builder!
review: This is a great little set that will help you be able to build up your soldier and pirate army!  I really like the braking wall effect and the shooting cannon.  What is good about this set also is that one of the extra pieces is another sword, so the pirate and soldier both have swords!  I intend to get seven more of these for a project I am doing!

author: Bricktoothyo
title: Pretty cool...
review:
this set isnt bad at all-its got a good number of pieces/features-a pirate and a red soldier.
Perfect little army builder-but ive gotta say the look of the new pirates really doesnt do it for me-the faces just dont seem piratey enough in my opinion.
That said I dig the soldiers,im glad they seem to be balancing the pirates/soldiers out evenly this time around.
all up I gave it a 4.

author: Paradoxymoron
title: Awesome
review: This is one of those sets that has great parts so if you don't like it( I can't immagine why you wouldn't) you can build something else. It has a firing cannon, a soldier, a pirate,and a rock. It ame with two swords(one extra) a musket, a map, two "Cannon balls" and a torch thing made of a stick, a telescope and a new flame peice.The works really well and the first time I used it on the rock I shot out the bottom part but the top part stayed there! Get this set now!

author: pirate_mason
title: Going Out With a Bang (literaly)
review:
This is a great set the smallest pirate set. It has a feature, but not much of one. You shoot the cannon and the wall collapses. This is my last set as I recede into my dark ages. For me that only means I'm done getting sets and building things. 
Pros: The cannon SHOOTS!

Great minifigs, even the backs are not solid color.
A few weapons
Cant resist those wheels

Cons: Overpriced, but not by much
Needs more minifigs
Better wall would be nice

I recommend this set.

author: sudorum
title: not much to it
review: THis lego is one of the simplest you can build, its kinda worthless though. just a wall and cannon. Woop-de-doo. However, the characters are rare, along with the igniting fuse which includes a rare flame. Good for a simple gift.an ok addition to your pirate collection, but i think its just too simple to be of much use.

author: jonbuddy
title: Nice and Easy [to build]
review:
Quick build, but has a long period of fun playing time!

Good:
45 pieces
Rifle
Map
Admiral
Pirate
Cannon
Breakable wall

Bad:
Wall breaks too easily
Takes a couple shots to blow up the wall depending on how good you aim

Overall:

or
9.8/10

author: bluemoose
title: A nice little set
review:
This is a great little set, and an ideal 'army builder'.

The firing canon is a highlight; the wall is designed to easily fall apart when hit by the canon ball.

A great addition to the new Pirates range, but also a nice little set in its own right.

Highly recommended.

author: pdcarson
title: Great Starter Set
review:
Great starter set for any new pirate fan (or like myself an old pirate fan getting back into collecting).  You get 2 minis with this set and a great cannon on a cart.  Anyway on to the pro/con list

Pro
-A Pirate and an Imperial
-An extra sword in the kit!
-a great cannon (I'd buy more sets just for this cart type cannon)

Con
- the wall designed to breakway is a bit flimsy (falls apart way to easy)  maybe should have had a cross beam at the top where just the middle blew out.
- As mentioned sets about $1.00 too high - still I'd pay it again for the great additions this set brings to any pirate collection.


As an aside I notices the pirate and imperial heads are reversed from the package picture to the build instructions.  Just a neat little "error".

author: Nuke
title: A great play set
review:
This set is simple and nice.
My little kid love it.. it shoot the cannon and destroy the wall, and have a lot of fun.
As adult lego fan, i love it for the pieces in it (the flame/plume) the swords, and the pieces.
I have one of this set but i think i'll buy one or two more just for extra minifig and cannons for my battles.

As mentioned by other users i have found a dark green hat for the pirate, and the head of pirate and soldier, in the instructions, are reversed.

I reccomend this set especially if you want give it to a kid for playing or if you are an adult fan!!

author: Lambman
title: Awsome start to an awsome theme
review:
Cannon Battle is a great set. Boy was I suprised when my Mom gave it to me on Christmas (Well, actually the 16th of December because I was going to my dads house and wouldnt see my mom till new years, so, ya) Anyway, The build is good and the Figs are even better. They have front and back printing!
The cannon shoots really well and can blow the pirates little wall to smitherenes. To the Pros we love and the Cons we love to hate:

Pros:
Soldier
Pirate
Cannon
Cannon works
Cannon can blow up the wall

Cons:
Wal falls apart if a fly lands on it 

Scores:
Build: 8/10
Playability: 10/10 (Sword fights, explosions, cant get much better than that)
Pieces: 9/10 (New Flame/Plume, Shooting cannon, plants are always nice)
Price: 8/10 (CAD 4.99 would have been better)

Overall: 8.90/10

author: JBH75
title: Get 2 for 1 fun
review:
This set is so cool I got 2 of these! I love to fire cannonballs at both walls (which I later put together), and blow up the pirate (Or the Cowardly Imperial). Here's a pro and con list.

Pros:
Cheap set with a firing cannon
Musket and cutlasses, and a cool torch
Cool map
Double sided torsos
It's a pretty simple and a fun build

Cons:
Needs some animals like a fish, parrot or snake

This sets is good, and at a Canadian price of $6.99 you should get 2 to battle with your friends, or to destory a huge wall!!"

author: jof
title: Fantastic
review:
My 6yr old son says:
Because it as a treasure map.
It has a cannon that shoots
It has some gold (well the roof bit is gold)

I say:
You get 2 people at pocket money price, weapons and the return of a cheap Shooting cannon set.  Now our pirates & navy can both have a cannon.

They missed a trick by not showing the telescope used as a telescope on the pack illustrations.

author: Legonater
title: And FIRE!
review:
This is my first Pirates set, adn I am inmprerssed. 
First, the pirate and hide-out
The pirate himself ios awesome. He has a gun, a map, and I gave him the extra sword that came with the set. Strangly, the wall has a gold piece on the top that's screaming, "There's a priate hiding here!" 
Soldier and cannon.
Very well put together. There is a piece on the back that the soldier can hold on to to carry in the cannon. Then the soldier picks up ther cool torch- it has two new pieces attached onto a rod. Then pulll back and... FIRE!

author: hustla187
title: Good Pirates Set
review: Although I'm not impressed with the new Pirates theme, I do like this set. It reminds us that the Golden Age of Pirates sets are over but gives us a flashback to that period. I like the cannon alot and the two minifigs in this set. Overall, this set is good but not great.

author: Shadow_Crawler
title: Somewhat Disappointing
review:
Well, as the title suggests, this is pretty disappointing.
Box : 5/5
This is the only thing in this set that I considered perfectly created. It really attract customers-to-be to buy this little money-sucker.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Instructions : 2/5
There are several mistakes in the instructions. The minifig head for the pirate and the soldier is wrong. they put the pirate's head on the soldier and vice versa. Another mistake is on Step 6. The yellowish golden monocular should be placed with the bigger side downward, not upward. But this instructions have a jagged feature on the upper right side, to resemble a cliff, maybe.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Building : 4/5
Not very interesting, kinda boring when building this one. The most interesting part is the base of the wall.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Playability : 4/5
Well, I must give a four for the playability because even though it's gotta be the only reason we buy this set, the cannon doesn't shoot far sometimes. It requires precise pull to let it fly far enough and strong enough. More cons, if you direct the cannon downward, the ammo will fall, thanks to gravity and Newton. I wonder how the cannon on Brickbeard's Bounty will shoot the soldier's boat. Even more cons, The wall isn't connected by stud-tube. It is just placed there without any connection at all. I know this is supposed to make the wall easily break apart when shot, but it would be better if there's at least one stud and one tube connecting, so it won't fall apart when you  brought it to a friend's house, for example.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Detail : 4/5
The detail's pretty good for this set. There's a map and plants on the wall. You also have two ammo for the cannon.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Compare With Money : 2/5
In the US, this set is priced for $ 5.99, which is a pretty good price. However in Indonesia, this set is priced for Rp. 134.900.00, which is equal to $ 11.74 or roughly twice the US price, so I don't think this is worth enough if you're outside US.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Overall : 3.5/5
Basically, there's only two reasons you would want to buy this : You want to build a cannon soldier army, and you just want to complete your pirate collection. It wasn't good for army building, sonce Soldier's Arsenal is much more cheaper and you get equipments. If you want to have at least one cheap Pirates in your collection, I suggest you get Krakken' Attacking.

Regards,
Shadow Crawler

author: Leggodt94
title: Load the Cannon!
review: I decided to get this set as a small inexpensive sample of the new pirates theme. And, so far, I'm liking what a I'm seeing. The set features to minifigs: a pirate with a sword and map and a British soldier with a musket and sword. The cannon fires with an interesting new design. Just load the cannon with one of the ammunition pieces, pull back the handle thing on the back and it fires away with great precision! Also, the wall breaks and fixes easy. And, the set features a cool cannon lighter with cool realistic fire piece on top. Well, to sum things up, this set is great! It's especially great if you need more soldiers and pirates, then you could use this set as a cheap battle pack. I look forward to acquiring more pirate sets soon.

author: mvila09
title: 6239 Cannon Battle
review: I got this set at Toys R Us and it's pretty cool.I also must admit this is my first Pirate set.Pros:Pirate,English Soldier,The cannon fires far!,Cool fire piece(I wish it can fit Boba Fett's jetpack!),Golden telescope,Good accessories.Cons:You touch the wall and it breaks!,This set is missing an animal.But you should buy this set.It's easy and fun to build.*****5 stars

author: michaelvader

review:

author: SaintElsewhere

author: legomakes3
title: This gave my American Revolution wheels! Oh, yeah!
review:
When I bought this set a month ago, I was really happy. Now, the happiness continues with the Cannon battle. The wheels on the cannon cart look exactly like wheels on American Rev. or Civil War artilery. Now, I can make renacments of the American Rev. with my Imperials, and my pirates could be the townsfolks. Thank you, Cannon Battle! Now, here are my pros and cons.

author: kaboomlegoman
title: great shooter!
review: This set is awesome. my downfall is that the cannon doesn't shoot well sometimes. It's fun blasting the wall to pieces. The new pirate gun is pretty cool! So is the cannon lighter. Overall great set especially for the cannon.

author: lotographia
title: Land superiority.
review:
Without having a ship of their own yet, the navy use their resources to gain superiority on the land instead. Bad luck to any pirate ship that encounters an army of these cannons when attempting to pillage a town.

The two minifigs in this set are great, as are all pirate minifigs so far, but unfortunately if you own any other pirate set you'll almost certainly already have one or the other of these chaps already.

There isn't much rebuild potential for this set - the only thing I can think of is to rebuild the wall into a small fortification for the cannon. It should be extremely easy to attach the cannon to a horse though I haven't tried this yet.

If I had done this set myself I would have replaced the wall with a horse and the pirate with another soldier. Realistically the cannon needs to be transported somehow and would require at least two people to work in battle. Also I would have given it a black antenna for a ramrod. Then it would be perfect.

The cannon and soldier would make great 'army builders' if that didn't also mean you'd end up with lots of identically walls. Since this is a play set aged at 5-12, though, it makes sense that they'd focus on the play potential of soldier vs pirate rather than the collectible potential of cannon, horse and two soldiers.

A GREAT SET TO BUILD UP AN ARMY OF BOTH SIDES.

author: Ha876
title: horrible without other pirates
review: this set comes with 2 minifigs ( 1 pirate and 1 soldier) which are no fun without other pirate sets. The cannon works pretty good and the little shelter also breaks apart well when the cannon hits it. As i said before, only good if you have other pirate sets. I would give this set a 5.5/10

author: Nased
title: Excellent 1 vs 1 set of the Pirate Series
review:
This set is absolutely awesome for many reasons. I can easily name five pros as compared to the only minor con of this set. Here are the summary:

 

Pros:

1) Low cost: I paid SGD$10 for this set at some sales and it's really cheap in my opinion.

 

2) Great army builder: The additional pirate is a good addition to the small crew onboard of 6243 (Brickbeard's Bounty) and the soldier is a good addtion to the relatively insufficient crew members onboard of 10210 (Imperial Flagship).

 

3) Good torso prints: The prints on both the minifigure is really great and it is really nice to collect more of such good minifigures.

 

4) Weapons: This set comes with a long rifle for the pirate which he can bring with it onboard of 6243 (Brickbeard's Bounty). There are two swords which the soldier and the pirate can take one each and have a sword fight.

 

5) Cannon: Most important of this feature of the set is the additional cannon which is a perfect addtion to my Imperial Flagship which has only cannons when the ship has eight openings for cannons.

 

Cons: I do not know what to do with the grey bricks of this set except for some MOC purposes.

 

Conclusion: It is a must get set and I had great fun playing with this and shifting all the accessories onboard of the largest pirate ship and largest army ship in this series.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: Great army builder
review:
The Cannon Battle (6239) is a LEGO Pirate set which came out in 2009. This set includes 2 minifigures: a pirate and a soldier. The only mistake I found in the instruction is the changed head of the soldier and the pirate: The soldier's head is on the pirate's torso and the pirate's head is on the soldier's torso. This set will take you about 10 minutes to build and it's very simple.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6239-1.jpg[/img]

Minifigures:
  • Pirate: The pirate has a nice shirt and he comes with a gun and a map which you can get in some LEGO Indiana Jones sets. His torso is double-sided and he got a basic LEGO City face.
  • Soldier: The soldier looks much better than the older soldiers from the 80's and 90's. They have a double-sided torso and a printed hat. He comes with a torch and a sword.
Features:

The cannon does fire easily and the wall will slide down if you hit it.

Positive:

  • Great army builder
  • No stickers
Negative:

  • A little bit to simple. Some might like the bigger models
All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XpUpMfnKVwM
Review: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1PD5OH23580

author: LEGOwikiguy
title: Hey, look, he got the map! Now he just has to stay alive...
review:
Haha! This set is pretty good for the new LEGO Pirates collector (Like myself), and this was my first Pirates set. I really liked the set (It broke), especially a cheep way for an army builder with a cannon. Though you can't really do much with it, it is fun. Pros and cons? Here they are:

Pros:
1. Two figures, both opposing and battling each other
2. Arg! ye map be in de set
3. A wall to protect the pirate...or blow him off the island...
4. good price

Cons:
1. The wall isnt secure at all! So a little modification would work out of spare pieces, and you're all set. Then you can still blast it, but keep it from falling off when moving it.
2. The cannon ball won't shoot if you don't pull the trigger back right (But this is in all LEGO Pirates sets with cannons)

I recommend this set to any new Pirates fan, especially due to its modular build. Also good for a birthday gift/stocking stuffer.

author: Eric_Bricks
title: Erm.... what?
review: I own two of these sets by now. I bought one, got the other while I was at summer camp via mail. I do wish the thing you blasted was easier to keep together. Also, I opened the box and found one of the pieces missing in my second copy of the set. Also, the front of the box showed the figures assembled one way, while the instruction booklet showed them assembled a different way. I can't speak for the community, but I'm lost.

author: NickBrick
title: Why did I only get one Pirate set! why!
review:
This sadly is my only pirate set.And what a set it is.Cannon battle came out when Lego had started replacing 5$ sets with 6$ you have to pay an extra buck now.But this is worth the extra cash you pay.The cannon has an accurate shot and explodes the wall really well.
The mini-figs rock to.The royal gaurd is one of my favorite mini-figs.Why is everyone trashing the wall? we need more rock walls and sand colored plates.This is a great somewhat cheap set but is now really hard to find.In fact I think Toys r us and borders are the only places that still sell a pirate set or two.

author: LobsterWarrior
title: "How'd you carry a cannon with you on a remote island?" -Pirate
review:
This set is great! I love it! It's got the huge cannon that works and launches the brick a LONG direction! The minifigures? The best. Two more into the collection! KA-CHING! I love the way of how a lone pirate carried a huge cannon into a remote island, where another pirate with the map to a treasure just happened to be hiding! (Sarcasm, it never fails anyone.) The rock and cannon both make good playability, since the rock slides off itself! 
I'm sorry for the short review, but a short review for a small set only fits itself.
Overall, only get this set if you want the minifigures and some pieces for the spare parts bin.

3.4/10

author: Odeinoichus
title: I Know Those Guns
review:
Set #6239 Cannon Battle: Arrrrr, mateys, Lego be returnin' to Pirates says I. And that's just great in my book. This was my first set from the new Pirates Theme and I have to say it's not that bad, but for the price they could have included maybe a third Mini-Figure or even better the Monkey.

 

I like it despite the flaws, but there are a few noticeable problems with this set from a collectors standpoint. And most of those flaws can be summed up in one sentence... How does hiding behind a blast-apart wall that small protect you from a cannon that big!?

 

The new Mini-Figures in the Pirate theme are a nice update from the classic theme. I used to have quite a number of them and all around I can safely say these new ones are impressive looking. I especially like the new double-sided printing LEGO has implemented in recent years for the torsos. Now you get to see what their outfits look like from the back.

 

The pieces included with this set accessorywise are also new to me and really neat. (Well as far as the cannon and the telescope go, I've seen those cutlasses and blunderbusts before.) It's a nice cheap set, but I think LEGO could have done better with the blast-apart wall.

 

Building wise there isn't much here, one cannon on wheels and one tiny little wall that can be blown apart by the Real Firing Cannonballs! (I am so impressed by this addition alone, my old Pirate sets never included actual firing cannons, so getting one of them for me was like christmas coming early or something.)

 

Overall I'd have to say that this set is worth it if you can get it on sale, but paying full price for it might be a little dissapointing. Still it is a nice little set for troop building, and if you bought enough of them maybe you could actually build a proper protective barricade for the gaggle of Pirates now being attacked by the swarm of cannons.

author: wipefeetnmat
title: Cool addition to a LEGO collection
review:
This is a cheap easy build set great for beginners. Here are some of the Pros and Cons:

 

Pros: Cannon that actually fires.

 The wall has a cool gold piece on the top.

 Fairly cheap for two figures and a cannon.

 

Cons: The figures are the same to many others in different pirate sets. 

 Wall is to small for the pirate to hide behind.

 

     All in all the set is a fairly good addition to any collection.

author: vith
title: Small, yet charming.
review: A small set which you'll probably buy for the cannon and the two minifigs. The wall isn't much of a build. Costs 8 EUR in Belgium, which is a little too much.. Would've rather paid 5 EUR. Anyway, it's a Pirates set and as a Pirates fan you'll have to buy it. ;)

author: ochart
title: cool cannon and minifigs
review:
this is a small set, however it has a great value
first you get two minifigs in a $10 set, and you get a cannon 
there's also a little wall that the cannon's supposed to destroy but the set would be fine without it
overall, great value and fun to play with

author: Ernst
title: Cannon battle, good set and great parts !
review:
Overall 5 bricks : A small set with good parts, great playability and an affordable price. A must have for a Pirates collector and a nice addition for others to play with or for parts.

 

Building 3 bricks : the building is not spectacular which is normal for a small set. The only thing you built is the pirates defence wall so not that hard. The cannon you assemble so not more than 3 bricks here.

 

Parts 5 bricks : 2 nice minifigures, a cannon, weapons, a torch, green leafes, treasurecard and all usefull bricks. Very good for a set this size.

 

Playability 5 bricks : in advance you know who wins the battle but still the set itself has great playability and combined with other Pirates sets even more.

 

Value 5 bricks : a great set for a small price, new already for € 4,99 in Holland and used even less. A single used rare minifigure costs the same, 5 bricks well at place.

author: Mr__Thrawn
title: Simple, But it Works
review:
This was a nice set that I had when I was younger. It has since been disassembled. I think. It was like 10 years ago.

 

Box and Instructions

The box is miniscule. I mean it. It's probably around 3.5" square, and 2" deep. When you have successfully mutilated it by tearing open the pushtab, you get to dump out all forty-five parts in a single tiny bag. Oh joy.  Then come the instructions. It's been said that these instructions are possibly the most frustrating items known to man. Many have been driven mad by the glacial pace of the instructions shown in the miniscule images. And then comes the comic strip, to add insult to injury. In all honesty, this isn't the kind of set you buy for the box.

 

Build

Ehm. It doesn't really exist. Sticking a cannon into a little cradle and sticking some grey bits together loosely with a mystical gold thingy on top isn't what I'd really call an earth-shattering experience.

 

Completed

There's a wall and a cannon. That's pretty much it. The wall is essentially an exercise in frugality and redundancy. It's too short for our jolly pirate to hide behind, and too small to produce a satisfying collapse when it's fired upon. Also, what the heck is that little gold thing? A magical talisman? A small ornament? Some short of shield projector to save Mr. Jolly Pirate (I think I'll call him Jimmy)?The cannon is also ridiculously small. A tiny grey-ish tube resting upon a red-ish box. Huzzah. It can be fired, though, and this was one of the first sets to include said feature since the early 90s. Again, though, it really doesn't have any effect on the wall.

Minifigures

Jimmy the pirate is nice, with a striped shirt, green bandana, and JANG face.

The soldier is much better. He does, however look extremely perturbed about something. Very. So upset as to border on sadistic.

Overall

This is a small set with almost no resale value. It's great for kids, and Pirates completionists will want it. Other than that, the set is a bit... meh. Not bad, but not good either.

 

Summary- Mediocre. Not bad, but meh.
